The Shout is a 1978 British psychological horror yarn, adapted from Robert Graves' short story by Jerzy Skolimowski. A disturbing tale of Aboriginal magic in the West Country is told by one score-keeper to another (Alan Bates & Tim Curry) at an insane asylumÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s staff/patient cricket match.

The story centres on the cuckolding of a musician (John Hurt) by an enigmatic stranger (Bates), who claims to have the power to kill with his special shout.

The plot though engaging is slight, however the direction is subtle and performances impressive. A disquietening atmosphere pervades the film; good use is made of sound and music.

Also, a young Jim Broadbent does his best to be noticed in a small role. 


Director: Jerzy Skolimowski
Cast: Alan Bates, Susannah York, John Hurt, Tim Curry, Robert Stephens.
